items.text: Maschil of Asaph.
items.plainText: Maschil of Asaph.

items.text: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
items.plainText: Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

items.text: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:
items.plainText: I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:

items.text: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
items.plainText: Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

items.text: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.
items.plainText: We will not hide them from their children, shewing to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.

items.text: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:
items.plainText: For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:

items.text: That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:
items.plainText: That the generation to come might know them, even the children which should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:

items.text: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:
items.plainText: That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:

items.text: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.
items.plainText: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.

items.text: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.
items.plainText: The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.

items.text: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;
items.plainText: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;

items.text: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.
items.plainText: And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.

items.text: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
items.plainText: Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

items.text: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.
items.plainText: He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as an heap.

items.text: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.
items.plainText: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.

items.text: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.
items.plainText: He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.

items.text: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.
items.plainText: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

items.text: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.
items.plainText: And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most High in the wilderness.

items.text: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.
items.plainText: And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their lust.

items.text: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
items.plainText: Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

items.text: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?
items.plainText: Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?

items.text: Therefore the LORD heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;
items.plainText: Therefore the LORD heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;

items.text: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:
items.plainText: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:

items.text: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,
items.plainText: Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,

items.text: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.
items.plainText: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.

items.text: Man did eat angels' food: he sent them meat to the full.
items.plainText: Man did eat angels' food: he sent them meat to the full.

items.text: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.
items.plainText: He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.

items.text: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:
items.plainText: He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:

items.text: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.
items.plainText: And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their habitations.

items.text: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;
items.plainText: So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;

items.text: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,
items.plainText: They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat was yet in their mouths,

items.text: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.
items.plainText: The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.

items.text: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.
items.plainText: For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.

items.text: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.
items.plainText: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.

items.text: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after God.
items.plainText: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and enquired early after God.

items.text: And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.
items.plainText: And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.

items.text: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.
items.plainText: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they lied unto him with their tongues.

items.text: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.
items.plainText: For their heart was not right with him, neither were they stedfast in his covenant.

items.text: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.
items.plainText: But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yea, many a time turned he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.

items.text: For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.
items.plainText: For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

items.text: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!
items.plainText: How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!

items.text: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.
items.plainText: Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.

items.text: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.
items.plainText: They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.

items.text: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:
items.plainText: How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:

items.text: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.
items.plainText: And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.

items.text: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.
items.plainText: He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.

items.text: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.
items.plainText: He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their labour unto the locust.

items.text: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.
items.plainText: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees with frost.

items.text: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
items.plainText: He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

items.text: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.
items.plainText: He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.

items.text: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;
items.plainText: He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

items.text: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:
items.plainText: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:

items.text: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
items.plainText: But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

items.text: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
items.plainText: And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

items.text: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.
items.plainText: And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.

items.text: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
items.plainText: He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

items.text: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:
items.plainText: Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:

items.text: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
items.plainText: But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

items.text: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.
items.plainText: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

items.text: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:
items.plainText: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

items.text: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;
items.plainText: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;

items.text: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy's hand.
items.plainText: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy's hand.

items.text: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.
items.plainText: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.

items.text: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.
items.plainText: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

items.text: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.
items.plainText: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.

items.text: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.
items.plainText: Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.

items.text: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.
items.plainText: And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a perpetual reproach.

items.text: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
items.plainText: Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:

items.text: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.
items.plainText: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.

items.text: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.
items.plainText: And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.

items.text: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:
items.plainText: He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:

items.text: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.
items.plainText: From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

items.text: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.
items.plainText: So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.
